conclusion: The problem involves a semi-circular conductor frame with a radius of r in a uniform magnetic field B. A conductor rod OC can slide on the frame, and a resistor R is connected between O and C. The resistances of the conductor frame and rod are negligible. OC rotates uniformly with angular velocity Ï‰.
The power of the external force doing work is P = \( \frac{1}{2} \omega^2 B^2 \pi r^4 \).
Calculate the induced emf in the loop: \( \epsilon = \omega B \pi r^2 \).

premise: The induced emf is \( \epsilon = \omega B \pi r^2 \).
conclusion: Calculate the current in the loop: \( I = \frac{\epsilon}{R} = \frac{\omega B \pi r^2}{R} \).

premise: The current in the loop is \( I = \frac{\omega B \pi r^2}{R} \).
conclusion: Calculate the power of the external force doing work: \( P = I^2 R = \left(\frac{\omega B \pi r^2}{R}\right)^2 R = \frac{1}{2} \omega^2 B^2 \pi r^4 \).
